decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo using cards like Crop Rotation, Exploration, and Thespian's Stage. Once the combo is set up, it can create a 20/20 Marit Lage token with indestructible, overwhelming opponents with a powerful threat. The deck also includes utility lands like Karakas and Bojuka Bog to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Sylvan Library and Life from the Loam helps with card selection and graveyard recursion, providing the deck with consistency and resilience.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards to cast Doomsday, which allows the player to stack their deck in a specific order to win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck utilizes various ways to draw cards, protect the combo with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze, and generate mana quickly through cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual. The goal is to efficiently set up the combo and execute it for a quick victory before the opponent has a chance to respond.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's hand and board with cards like Thoughtseize, Smallpox, and Liliana of the Veil, while also utilizing cards like Wasteland and Mishra's Factory to disrupt their mana base. Additionally, the deck aims to lock the opponent out of the game with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale. Karn, the Great Creator and Urza's Saga provide additional toolbox options and utility, allowing the player to adapt to various situations and threats.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly assemble the Cloudpost mana engine to ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and Ulamog. The deck utilizes cards like Crop Rotation and Karn, the Great Creator to search for key lands and artifacts, while also utilizing acceleration from cards like Elvish Spirit Guide and Once Upon a Time. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Bojuka Bog and Karn's ability to shut down opponents' strategies. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient ramp and powerful threats.

The main focus of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to use efficient Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to ramp into big threats with mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb while also utilizing Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin to cheat out powerful Eldrazi creatures. The deck also includes ways to generate additional advantage, such as Sowing Mycospawn and Kozilek's Command, to further solidify its position as an aggressive and disruptive force in the Legacy format.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Troll of Khazad-d√ªm, Griselbrand, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then using spells like Exhume, Reanimate, and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield. Cards like Unmask and Thoughtseize are used to disrupt the opponent's hand and clear the way for the reanimated creatures to take over the game. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats before they can respond effectively.

The deck is focused on assembling the combo of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill cards and create a loop that allows for Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The key strategy is to protect the combo pieces with counterspells like Force of Will and disruption like Teferi, Time Raveler, while also utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for the combo pieces. The deck aims to quickly and efficiently set up the combo and win the game before the opponent can disrupt it.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Counterbalance to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Terminus and Swords to Plowshares provide efficient removal, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help to dig through the deck for key pieces. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind them down with a combination of control elements and card advantage. It plays a reactive game plan until it can establish a dominant board presence and close out the game.
